references.paper_title: You only look once: Unified, real-time object detection
references.reason: This paper introduced the original YOLO architecture, which is foundational to the YOLO series and the subject of the current paper.

references.paper_title: YOLOv4: Optimal speed and accuracy of object detection
references.reason: YOLOv4 significantly advanced the YOLO architecture, improving both speed and accuracy, setting a high benchmark for subsequent YOLO versions.

This paper introduced the DETR approach, a transformer-based object detection method, which provides a valuable alternative to the anchor-based YOLO approach and is directly compared to in this paper.

references.paper_title: YOLOv7: Trainable bag-of-freebies sets new state-of-the-art for real-time object detectors
references.reason: YOLOv7 represents a recent state-of-the-art YOLO model, providing a strong comparison for performance evaluation and contextual background for the current research.
This paper introduced YOLOv8, which is directly used as a baseline model in this paper, demonstrating the influence and importance of this work.
